value.name: General election poll tracker
value.description: R eform UK is now polling consistently in joint third alongside the Liberal Democrats amid anger at the Conservatives over their handling of illegal migration, The Telegraph’s tracker shows. Richard Tice’s party is holding on to a 10 per cent share of national voting intention, which puts it on an equal footing with the Lib Dems.

value.name: Off-peak Friday fares trial to start for Tube and trains in London
value.description: Off-peak Tube and train fares all day on Fridays will be trialled by Transport for London (TfL) in a bid to boost passenger numbers and support the capital's economy. Sadiq Khan has asked TfL to launch a three-month trial in March. He said the organisation's usage data showed Fridays were quieter than any other week day.

value.name: Ex-central banker Carney backs Trudeau to lead Liberals in Canada's next election
value.description: (Reuters) - Former central bank Governor Mark Carney on Sunday said he supported Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau leading the Liberal Party into the next federal election, quashing speculation that Carney would mount his own leadership bid.

value.description: The fix must be a neutral and permanent map-making process that both major political parties — and more important, the voting public — can accept.
